snippet: The report of a $93 billion bid for Telefónica of Spain, which was later denied, is a sign of the problem AT&T faces: it has a lofty stock multiple, which makes mergers tempting, but it seems shut out of both domestic and foreign deals.
abstract: The report of a $93 billion bid for Telefónica of Spain, which was later denied, is a sign of the problem AT&T faces: it has a lofty stock multiple, which makes mergers tempting, but it seems shut out of both domestic and foreign deals.

headline.main: AT&T Ready for a Deal, but Nowhere to Go
